headline: Trump begins four-day trip to Middle East in Saudi Arabia
text: President Trump begins his four-day trip to the Middle East, landing in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday. Meeting with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, Trump signed several defense and economic agreements and facilitating access to sell semiconductors to Saudi Arabia. Brad Smith and Madison Mills outline Trump's Cabinet members who are set to speak in Saudi Arabia and the tech CEOs who have followed the administration, including Tesla's (TSLA) Elon Musk and Nvidia's (NVDA) Jensen Huang. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief here.

headline: Stock market today: Dow jumps 1,100 points, S&P 500 and Nasdaq surge after US-China tariff rollback triggers buying spree
text: US and China said they have agreed to slash most tariffs for 90 days while further trade talks take place.

headline: US-China tariff pause may save the year for retailers
text: Retailers can sigh a bit of relief as Chinese tariffs are paused, at least until August.

headline: Amazon taps FedEx for big-and-bulky residential deliveries
text: Amazon will outsource delivery of large packages to FedEx in a deal that should prove more profitable on a per-shipment level than shipments under the companies’ partnership that ended six years ago. The post Amazon taps FedEx for big-and-bulky residential deliveries appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: With UPS Out, Amazon Turns to FedEx
text: FedEx stock fell Tuesday after Amazon.com said it would be working with the logistics provider on last-mile delivery. FedEx shares were up in premarket trading, but gains faded, leaving them down 0.3% at $232.16. Despite the drop, BofA Securities analyst Ken Hoexter said the Amazon business will be “accretive to yields and profitability.”

headline: These Stocks Are Moving the Most Today: UnitedHealth, Nvidia, Tesla, First Solar, Coinbase, Boeing, Hertz, Rigetti, and More
text: UnitedHealth names a new CEO and suspends its 2025 outlook, Nvidia and the rest of the Magnificent Seven stocks rise after the group collectively added $831 billion in market cap on Monday, and Coinbase shares jump after it was announced the cryptocurrency trading platform will be added to the S&P 500.

headline: Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN): A Bull Case Theory
text: We came across a bullish thesis on Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN) on Substack by LongYield. In this article, we will summarize the bulls’ thesis on AMZN. Amazon.com, Inc. (AMZN)’s share was trading at $188.71 as of May 7th. AMZN’s trailing and forward P/E were 30.73 and 29.07 respectively according to Yahoo Finance. Amazon’s Q1 2025 results highlight solid […]

headline: Amazon Takes A Further Bite Out Of The Big Apple, Closing Purchase Of 600,000 Square Feet At 522 Fifth Ave.

headline: Tap Mag-7 ETFs on Temporary US-China Trade Truce
text: The latest U.S.-China temporary trade truce came as a surprising relief to the Magnificent Seven space.

headline: Amazon launches AI-powered contextual ads at 2nd blockbuster upfront
text: Featuring loads of Hollywood star power, the tech giant’s presentation showed off results from the first full year of advertising on Prime Video.

headline: FedEx, Amazon strike large-package delivery deal
text: The agreement comes nearly six years after FedEx let its Express and Ground shipping contracts with the e-commerce giant expire.

headline: Advanced Micro Devices Stock (AMD) Stuck in Neutral as AI Boom Accelerates
text: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) has been a disappointing stock over the past year, with declines accelerating in the last five months. Since May 2024, AMD has been down almost 32%. Amid growing concerns about demand for AI infrastructure chips, AMD has also struggled with a lack of competitiveness in absorbing that demand. Even after posting a beat across the board in its Q1 earnings last week and supplementing that with raised Q2 guidance, there are still no strong signs of a reversal in the beari

headline: Trending tickers: Coinbase, Amazon, Meta, Boeing and M&S
text: The latest investor updates on stocks that are trending on Tuesday.

headline: Amazon Seals New Partnership With FedEx for Delivering Large Packages
text: Amazon says the company will join other partners including United Parcel Service and the U.S. Postal Service that regularly work alongside Amazon’s last-mile delivery network.

headline: Jeff Bezos Built A $1.97 Trillion Empire By Putting Truth Before Comfort—Here's Why He Thinks That's What Separates Great Companies From The Rest
text: What distinguishes a high-performing company from the rest? A culture that puts truth first, according to Jeff Bezos, who built Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) into $1.97 trillion e-commerce giant it is today. In his view, organizations must make space for honest conversations, even if they are awkward and uncomfortable. What Happened: Speaking to Lex Fridman in 2023, Bezos described truth-telling a learned skill, not a natural instinct. "We are social animals," he said. "Going along to get along

headline: These Stocks Moved the Most Today: Amazon, Nvidia, Tesla, Alibaba, Eli Lilly, Pfizer, NRG Energy, Newmont, and More
text: Amazon.com, Nvidia, Tesla, and the rest of the Magnificent Seven stocks jump as the U.S. and China reach an agreement to temporarily slash most tariffs on each other’s goods.

headline: Amazon.com (AMZN): Cloud and AI Momentum Reinforce Bullish Analyst Outlook
text: We recently published a list of 10 AI Stocks Making Moves This Week. In this article, we are going to take a look at where Amazon.com, Inc. (NASDAQ:AMZN) stands against other AI stocks making moves this week. Is China finally gaining supremacy in the AI arms race? Not quite, but executives from some of the […]

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Jones Rockets As Trump Makes This China Boast; Bill Ackman Stock Clears Key Level (Live Coverage)
text: The Dow Jones surged on the stock market today. President Donald Trump made a China boast amid tariff progress. A Bill Ackman stock soared. Alibaba cleared an entry.

headline: Stocks to Watch Monday: Apple, Nvidia, Broadcom, Shopify
text: ↗️ Amazon (AMZN); Apple (AAPL); Meta (META); Tesla (TSLA): The biggest U.S. tech stocks surged Monday after the White House and China agreed to hefty tariff cuts. Amazon sells many Chinese-made products on its platform; China is an important market for Tesla; and Apple does much of its assembly in the country.
